conversion_verification.notes: Walls clearly have height and thickness. The interior volume is perceptible, giving a sense of space. The viewing angle is isometric, and the roof/ceiling is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls are rendered with height and thickness (5/5). Floors are clear planes (3/3). Interior volume is percepible (4/4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3/3). Angled/isometric-like view (5/5). Interior visible from elevated perspective (3/3). Minimal severe perspective distortion (2/2). Roof/ceiling removed cleanly (5/5). Interior spaces fully visible (3/3). Clean geometry without broken sections (2/2). Total 30/35.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3/3). Correct adjacency relationships (4/4). Relative room proportions are mostly preserved, though some internal curves distort slightly (2/3). Major room identities match (2/2). Major wall positions align with 2D plan (5/5). Wall lengths are proportional (3/3). Internal partitions are mostly correctly placed, but the curved wall introduces a slight deviation from a strictly geometric translation (1/2). Doors are present and on correct walls (4/4). Windows are present and on correct walls, though some are generalized (1/2). Openings are proportionally sized and oriented, but the generalized windows slightly reduce this score (1/2). Total 22/30.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, tables) (4/4). Kitchen elements present (2/2). Bathroom fixtures present (2/2). Furniture placed in correct rooms (3/3). Furniture scale reasonable relative to room (2/2). Orientation logical relative to layout (1/2) - The bed is slightly rotated. Total 14/15.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings clearly distinguishable (4/4). Geometry readable and not visually confusing (4/4). Interior clearly visible (3/3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3/3). Consistent material usage (2/2). No major rendering artifacts or broken meshes (2/2). Clean background / presentation (2/2). Total 20/20.

detected_errors.description: The curved wall geometry in the bedroom/bathroom area is a significant deviation from the strictly rectilinear 2D floor plan, distorting the internal partition layout and proportions.
Windows are present but are generalized geometric blocks, not replicating the specific window types/widths shown in the 2D plan.

summary: A good 3D conversion successfully transforms the 2D plan into an isometric 3D model with clear depth and recognizable geometry, despite some liberties taken with the internal wall curvature.
